original: Bildsten, Nils Viktor, praktiserande läkare, Karlshamn, f. 22/3/97 i Hälsingborg av Nils B. o. Charlotta Andersson. G. 26 m. Margit Eriksson. Barn: Nils f. 28, Per 29, Lars 31, Gunilla 34, Birgitta 36. — Stud:ex. i Hälsingborg 17, med. kand. i Lund 27 o. med. lic. där 34. Off. v. Norra skånska inf :reg. 20’-24’. E. o. aman. v. kem. inst. i Lund 22-24 o. 25-27, aman. där 24-25, e. läk. v. kir. khn. i Lund 30, förordn. s. assist :läk. v. Lunds o. Hälsingborgs las. kir. avd., tf. prov:-läk. i Karlshamns distr. o. stadsläk. i Karlshamn 30-46, prakt. läk. i Karlshamn sed. 34, järnv:läk. v. Blek. Kustbanor sed. 40, dito v. SJ sed. 43, bat:-läk. i Fik res. SvRK förtj :med., Ehrenzeich. f. Deutsche Volkspflege 3 kl.
translated: Bildsten, Nils Viktor, practicing physician, Karlshamn, born March 22nd, 1897 in Helsingborg to Nils B. and Charlotta Andersson. Married in 1926 to Margit Eriksson. Children: Nils (born 1928), Per (born 1929), Lars (born 1931), Gunilla (born 1934), Birgitta (born 1936). He completed his secondary school education in Helsingborg in 1917, obtained a Bachelor of Medicine degree in Lund in 1927, and a Doctor of Medicine degree there in 1934. He was an officer in the Norra Skånska Infantry Regiment from 1920-1924, and was a trainee and assistant at the Chemistry Institute in Lund from 1922-1927. He served as a doctor at the surgical department of Lund University Hospital and Helsingborg Hospital, and was interim physician in Karlshamn district and city physician in Karlshamn from 1930-1946. He had a private medical practice in Karlshamn since 1934, and was a railway physician for Blekinge Coastal Railways from 1940 and for SJ from 1943. He was a naval physician in the Home Guard and awarded a medal for meritorious service, as well as the Decoration for German People's Welfare, 3rd class.
